meanings.definition: To cut (something) into pieces or shapes
meanings.sent1: She used a knife to carve a pumpkin for Halloween.
meanings.sent2: The artist will carve a beautiful sculpture out of wood.
meanings.sent3: He tried to carve a smiley face into the watermelon but it turned out lopsided.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to carve through his heart like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization would carve intricate designs into stone monuments.

meanings.definition: To make or create (something) by cutting
meanings.sent1: The carpenter will carve a new table from the sturdy oak wood.
meanings.sent2: She decided to carve her initials into the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: He tried to carve a boat out of the large watermelon, but it didn't float.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed seemed to carve a path through all obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The chef would carefully carve a swan out of a block of ice for the buffet display.

meanings.definition: To slice or cut (meat) into pieces for eating
meanings.sent1: Grandma will carve the Thanksgiving turkey at the dinner table.
meanings.sent2: The chef skillfully carved the roast beef for the guests.
meanings.sent3: He tried to carve the steak with a spoon, realizing he forgot his knife.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the freshly carved ham filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The family gathered around as Dad began to carve the roasted chicken for dinner.
